text: The Papua New Guinean ambassador in Beijing is the official representative of the government in Port Moresby to the Government of the People's Republic of China. ==List of representatives== {| class="wikitable sortable" !| Diplomatic agrément/Diplomatic accreditation !| ambassador !| Observations !| Prime Minister of Papua New Guinea !| Premier of the People's Republic of China !| Term end |- | | |Papua and New Guinea Act 1949 Independence from Australia | |Zhou Enlai | |- | | |Declared and recognised Independence from Australia |Michael Somare |Zhou Enlai | |- | | |The government in Beijing and Port Moresby established diplomatic relations |Michael Somare |Hua Guofeng | |- | |Joseph Kaal Nombri |Joseph Kaal Nombri |Michael Somare |Zhao Ziyang | |- | |Noel Levi |Noel Levi |Rabbie Namaliu |Li Peng | |- | |Maimu Raka-Nou |Maimu Raka-Nou |Julius Chan |Li Peng | |- | |Barney Rongap |Barney Rongap |John Giheno |Li Peng | |- | |Max Rai |Max Rai |Michael Somare |Wen Jiabao | |- | |John Momis |John Momis |Michael Somare |Wen Jiabao | |- | |Christopher Mero | |Peter O'Neill |Wen Jiabao | |} *China–Papua New Guinea relations == References == Papua New Guinea China
title: List of ambassadors of Papua New Guinea to China
